content:
# I encountered an issue while attempting to craft the Iron Gear Wheels due to insufficient Iron Plates. 
# I only have 4 Iron Plates available, but I need 20 Iron Plates to craft the required 10 Iron Gear Wheels.

# To address this, I will need to smelt some Iron Ore into Iron Plates first. 
# I currently have 6 Iron Ore in my inventory, which I can use to create more Iron Plates.

# Here's the plan:
1. **Smelt Iron Ore into Iron Plates**: I will place the Iron Ore into the Stone Furnace to produce Iron Plates.
2. **Check Fuel**: Ensure the Stone Furnace has enough fuel (Coal) to complete the smelting process.

# First, I will insert the 6 Iron Ore into the Stone Furnace and check if I have enough Coal to smelt them.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, target=stone_furnace_entity, quantity=6)  # Inserting 6 Iron Ore into the furnace.

# After this insertion, I will check the inventory of the Stone Furnace to confirm the amount of Iron Ore and Iron Plates it has.
furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(stone_furnace_entity)  # Inspect the furnace inventory after insertion.
print(f"Stone Furnace Inventory after inserting Iron Ore: {furnace_inventory}")  # Display the contents of the Stone Furnace after insertion.

# Now, I will wait for the smelting process to complete and check the inventory again.
for _ in range(30):  # Wait a maximum of 30 seconds for processing.
    if inspect_inventory(stone_furnace_entity)[Prototype.IronPlate] >= 10:  # Check if at least 10 Iron Plates are produced.
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")

# After waiting, I'll check my inventory to confirm the number of Iron Plates produced now.
print(f"Inventory after waiting for smelting to finish: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Checking inventory after waiting for smelting to complete.
